entry.content: Really feeling the constraints of 140 characters this morning #kodm

entry.content: @WendellPiez work with LMNL forcing him out of the XML space to find new possibilities and then returning with those new possibilities #kodm

entry.title: Piez: Technology-level data model (LMNL) allows building new higher-level data model of texts, exposing e.g. narrative structure #kodm
entry.content: Piez: Technology-level data model (LMNL) allows building new higher-level data model of texts, exposing e.g. narrative structure #kodm

entry.title: .@WendellPiez the alternate data model of LMNL opens up new ways of investigating texts (in this example Mary Shelley's Frankenstein) #kodm
entry.content: .@WendellPiez the alternate data model of LMNL opens up new ways of investigating texts (in this example Mary Shelley's Frankenstein) #kodm

entry.title: Can pull XML out of LMNL #kodm @WendellPiez
entry.content: Can pull XML out of LMNL #kodm @WendellPiez

entry.title: Nice SVG (zoomable!) visualisation of LMNL-marked up text. #kodm
entry.content: Nice SVG (zoomable!) visualisation of LMNL-marked up text. #kodm

entry.title: What is the advantage of using LMNL as a range-model over multiple standoff annotations of one text in XML? #kodm
entry.content: What is the advantage of using LMNL as a range-model over multiple standoff annotations of one text in XML? #kodm

entry.title: The demo that @WendellPiez is showing uses XSLT pipelines to progressively process the LMNL markup. #kodm
entry.content: The demo that @WendellPiez is showing uses XSLT pipelines to progressively process the LMNL markup. #kodm

entry.title: In LMNL, an annotation can have the same structure as any document (equivalent to putting a document in an XML attribute) #kodm
entry.content: In LMNL, an annotation can have the same structure as any document (equivalent to putting a document in an XML attribute) #kodm

entry.title: Overview of LMNL, a markup language but supporting markup overlap unlike XML. #kodm http://t.co/ep8VpiyJ
entry.content: Overview of LMNL, a markup language but supporting markup overlap unlike XML. #kodm http://t.co/ep8VpiyJ

entry.title: @WendellPiez in LMNL annotations can be marked up and can have metadata inside it. #kodm
entry.content: @WendellPiez in LMNL annotations can be marked up and can have metadata inside it. #kodm

entry.title: Tuning in as I am able to Data modeling in the Humanities over the next few days #kodm
entry.content: Tuning in as I am able to Data modeling in the Humanities over the next few days #kodm

entry.title: .@WendellPiez now discussing LMNL, an experimental markup language with different affordances from XML. Particularly handling overlap #kodm
entry.content: .@WendellPiez now discussing LMNL, an experimental markup language with different affordances from XML. Particularly handling overlap #kodm

entry.title: @WendellPiez "Can we conceive a viable markup regime with advantages of plain text, but without XMLs early commitment to hierarchy?" #kodm
entry.content: @WendellPiez "Can we conceive a viable markup regime with advantages of plain text, but without XMLs early commitment to hierarchy?" #kodm

entry.title: @knoxdw @wendellpiez What users won't think about tied to intellectual ends a project is aiming at. A kind of zooming in & out here #kodm
entry.content: @knoxdw @wendellpiez What users won't think about tied to intellectual ends a project is aiming at. A kind of zooming in & out here #kodm

entry.title: @knoxdw @wendellpiez Yes and deciding what "users won't need to think about" can vary project-by-project w/ostensibly similar data + #kodm
entry.content: @knoxdw @wendellpiez Yes and deciding what "users won't need to think about" can vary project-by-project w/ostensibly similar data + #kodm

entry.title: @WendellPiez more or less direct relationship between constraints and costs of a data model and the analytic power of that model. #kodm
entry.content: @WendellPiez more or less direct relationship between constraints and costs of a data model and the analytic power of that model. #kodm

entry.title: Interesting/useful hierarchy of costs/complexity in data-modelling technologies. Will these slides be available online? #kodm
entry.content: Interesting/useful hierarchy of costs/complexity in data-modelling technologies. Will these slides be available online? #kodm

entry.title: Good to shield uninterested users from details of data model, but interested users should have ability to play with it. #kodm
entry.content: Good to shield uninterested users from details of data model, but interested users should have ability to play with it. #kodm

entry.title: Need a set of ground rules that users don't have to think about. People can look this up, but not necessary @WendellPiez #kodm
entry.content: Need a set of ground rules that users don't have to think about. People can look this up, but not necessary @WendellPiez #kodm

entry.title: .@WendellPiez: part of design in data modeling is thinking about what end users presumably won't need to think about #kodm
entry.content: .@WendellPiez: part of design in data modeling is thinking about what end users presumably won't need to think about #kodm

entry.title: Wendell: we don't think abut letters of alphabet when we read a page. Don't know about that #kodm
entry.content: Wendell: we don't think abut letters of alphabet when we read a page. Don't know about that #kodm

entry.title: Reflexivity problem: in the humanities, we are frequently using text to model text. The result is a 'descriptive layers' problem. #kodm
entry.content: Reflexivity problem: in the humanities, we are frequently using text to model text. The result is a 'descriptive layers' problem. #kodm

entry.title: Do data models hurt as much as LEGOs when you step on them with bare feet in the middle of the night? #kodm
entry.content: Do data models hurt as much as LEGOs when you step on them with bare feet in the middle of the night? #kodm

entry.title: Wendell Piez: text can be defined as an encoding technology #kodm
entry.content: Wendell Piez: text can be defined as an encoding technology #kodm

entry.title: .@WendellPiez: modeling can include rules for assembly; also bricolage, inventive use things intended for another purpose #kodm
entry.content: .@WendellPiez: modeling can include rules for assembly; also bricolage, inventive use things intended for another purpose #kodm

entry.title: Humanities data-modelling described as frequently a 'bricolage' of disparate elements. #kodm
entry.content: Humanities data-modelling described as frequently a 'bricolage' of disparate elements. #kodm

entry.content: RT @triplingual: As with LEGOs, data models may (try to) convey restrictions as well as possibilities. #kodm

entry.title: As with LEGOs, data models may (try to) convey restrictions as well as possibilities. #kodm
entry.content: As with LEGOs, data models may (try to) convey restrictions as well as possibilities. #kodm

entry.title: .@WendellPiez Lego model of Brandenburg Gate: the model as the Gate, or as the pieces so that someone else can build the Gate #kodm
entry.content: .@WendellPiez Lego model of Brandenburg Gate: the model as the Gate, or as the pieces so that someone else can build the Gate #kodm

entry.title: #kodm @WendellPiez When we talk about models we are talking about several things, a technology that allows us to build and what we build.
entry.content: #kodm @WendellPiez When we talk about models we are talking about several things, a technology that allows us to build and what we build.

entry.content: @WendellPiez's 3 Questions: "What do we mean by data modeling?" "What about markup?" "What about schemas" #kodm
